Class Game

java.lang.Object
Game
Direct Known Subclasses:
Basketball, Football, Hockey, Soccer
public abstract class Game
extends java.lang.Object
This abstract class is the super-class for Basketball, Soccer, Hockey, and Football. It contains all of the concrete classes used to start a game, end a period, add a score, determine the winner, and more. It also contains two abstract methods used to get a specific sport's scoring methods, and to determine if the game is over.
Since:
10/3/2021
Author:
Tucker Dickson

    private Team awayTeam

    This private instance variable represents the current period of play of the game.

    This private instance variable refers to the Team object that represents the home team.
    private int lengthOfPeriod
    This private instance variable represents the length of the game-specific period of play.
    private java.lang.String nameOfPeriod
    This private instance variable represents the game-specific name of the period of play.

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game​(Team homeTeam, Team awayTeam, int lengthOfPeriod, java.lang.String nameOfPeriod)
      This is the sole constructor for the Game class. It takes in four parameters and simply uses them to set the four corresponding private instance variables.
      Parameters:
      homeTeam - This parameter is a Team object that will be used to set the homeTeam private instance variable.
      awayTeam - This parameter is a Team object that will be used to set the awayTeam private instance variable.
      lengthOfPeriod - This parameter is an int that will be used to set the lengthOfPeriod private instance variable.
      nameOfPeriod - This parameter is a String that will be used to set the nameOfPeriod private instance variable.

  • Method Details

    • setHomeTeam

      public void setHomeTeam​(Team homeTeam)
      This is the setter method for the homeTeam private instance variable. It takes one parameter and uses it to set homeTeam. This method is never called.
      Parameters:
      homeTeam - This parameter is the Team object that will be used to set the homeTeam private instance variable.

    • setAwayTeam

      public void setAwayTeam​(Team awayTeam)
      This is the setter method for the awayTeam private instance variable. It takes one parameter and uses it to set awayTeam. This method is never called.
      Parameters:
      awayTeam - This parameter is the Team object that will be used to set the awayTeam private instance variable.

    • getHomeTeam

      public Team getHomeTeam()
      This is the getter method for the homeTeam private instance variable. It doesn't take any parameters and it returns homeTeam.
      Returns:
      This method returns the homeTeam private instance variable.

    • getAwayTeam

      public Team getAwayTeam()
      This is the getter method for the awayTeam private instance variable. It doesn't take any parameters and it returns awayTeam.
      Returns:
      This method returns the awayTeam private instance variable.

    • getCurrentPeriodOfPlay

      public int getCurrentPeriodOfPlay()
      This is the getter method for the currentPeriodOfPlay private instance variable. It doesn't take any parameters and it returns currentPeriodOfPlay.
      Returns:
      This method returns the currentPeriodOfPlay private instance variable.

    • getLengthOfPeriod

      public int getLengthOfPeriod()
      This is the getter method for the lengthOfPeriod private instance variable. It doesn't take any parameters and it returns lengthOfPeriod. This method is never called.
      Returns:
      This method returns the lengthOfPeriod private instance variable.

    • getNameOfPeriod

      public java.lang.String getNameOfPeriod()
      This is the getter method for the nameOfPeriod private instance variable. It doesn't take any parameters and it returns nameOfPeriod.
      Returns:
      This method returns the nameOfPeriod private instance variable.

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      This method is called when a new game is started in main. It simply sets the home and away scores to zero and sets the current period to 1. This method doesn't take any parameters or return anything.

    • endCurrentPeriod

      public void endCurrentPeriod()
      This method is called whenever the user decides to end the current period of play. It simply increments the currentPeriodOfPlay private instance variable. This method doesn't take any parameters or return anything.

    • getWinner

      public Team getWinner()
      This method is responsible for determining the winner (or lack of) between homeTeam and awayTeam. This method doesn't take in any parameters, but it returns a Team object.
      Returns:
      This method returns the Team object corresponding to the winner of the game.

    • addScore

      public void addScore​(Team team, ScoringMethod scoringMethod)
      This method is responsible for adding a score to a Team. It takes two parameters, one referring to the team whose score is to be increased, and one referring to the score to increase by.
      Parameters:
      team - This Team object refers to the Team whose score needs to be increased.
      scoringMethod - This ScoringMethod object refers to the ScoringMethod that is to be used to increase the score.

    • getScoringMethods

      public abstract ScoringMethod[] getScoringMethods()
      This abstract method is responsible for returning the various scoring methods for a specific type of game. It returns the scoring methods in the form of an array of ScoringMethods.
      Returns:
      This method returns an array of ScoringMethods that contains all of the scoring methods for a particular game.

    • isGameOver

      public abstract boolean isGameOver()
      This abstract method is responsible for indicating whether or not a game is over. It does this by returning a boolean value.
      Returns:
      This method returns a boolean value that represents whether or not a game is over (true means game is over)
